 173 -    def send( 
 174          self, 
 175          to, 
 176          subject='None', 
 177          message='None', 
 178          attachments=None, 
 179          cc=None, 
 180          bcc=None, 
 181          reply_to=None, 
 182          encoding='utf-8' 
 183          ): 

 184          """ 
 185          Sends an email using data specified in constructor 
 186   
 187          Arguments:: 
 188   
 189              to: list or tuple of receiver addresses; will also accept single 
 190                  object 
 191              subject: subject of the email 
 192              message: email body text; depends on type of passed object: 
 193                       if 2-list or 2-tuple is passed: first element will be 
 194                       source of plain text while second of html text; 
 195                       otherwise: object will be the only source of plain text 
 196                       and html source will be set to None; 
 197                       If text or html source is: 
 198                       None: content part will be ignored, 
 199                       string: content part will be set to it, 
 200                       file-like object: content part will be fetched from 
 201                                         it using it's read() method 
 202              attachments: list or tuple of Mail.Attachment objects; will also 
 203                           accept single object 
 204              cc: list or tuple of carbon copy receiver addresses; will also 
 205                  accept single object 
 206              bcc: list or tuple of blind carbon copy receiver addresses; will 
 207                  also accept single object 
 208              reply_to: address to which reply should be composed 
 209              encoding: encoding of all strings passed to this method (including 
 210                        message bodies) 
 211   
 212          Examples:: 
 213   
 214              #Send plain text message to single address: 
 215              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 216                        'Message subject', 
 217                        'Plain text body of the message') 
 218   
 219              #Send text and html message to three addresses (two in cc): 
 220              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 221                        'Message subject', 
 222                        ('Plain text body', <html>html body</html>), 
 223                        cc=['other1@example.com', 'other2@example.com']) 
 224   
 225              #Send html only message with image attachment available from 
 226              the message by 'photo' content id: 
 227              mail.send('you@example.com', 
 228                        'Message subject', 
 229                        (None, '<html><img src="cid:photo" /></html>'), 
 230                        Mail.Attachment('/path/to/photo.jpg' 
 231                                        content_id='photo')) 
 232   
 233              #Send email with two attachments and no body text 
 234              mail.send('you@example.com, 
 235                        'Message subject', 
 236                        None, 
 237                        [Mail.Attachment('/path/to/fist.file'), 
 238                         Mail.Attachment('/path/to/second.file')]) 
 239   
 240          Returns True on success, False on failure. 
 241   
 242          Before return, method updates two object's fields: 
 243          self.result: return value of smtplib.SMTP.sendmail() or GAE's 
 244                       mail.send_mail() method 
 245          self.error: Exception message or None if above was successful 
 246          """ 
 247   
 248          if not isinstance(self.settings.server, str): 
 249              raise Exception('Server address not specified') 
 250          if not isinstance(self.settings.sender, str): 
 251              raise Exception('Sender address not specified') 
 252          if isinstance(to, str): 
 253              to = [to] 
 254          else: 
 255              to = list(to) 
 256          if len(to) == 0: 
 257              raise Exception('Target receiver address not specified') 
 258          payload = MIMEMultipart.MIMEMultipart('related') 
 259          payload['To'] = ', '.join(to).decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 260          if reply_to != None: 
 261              payload['Reply-To'] = reply_to.decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 262          payload['Subject'] = subject.decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 263          if cc != None: 
 264              if not isinstance(cc, (list, tuple)): 
 265                  cc = [cc] 
 266              payload['Cc'] = ', '.join(cc).decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 267              to.extend(cc) 
 268          if bcc != None: 
 269              if not isinstance(bcc, (list, tuple)): 
 270                  bcc = [bcc] 
 271              payload['Bcc'] = ', '.join(bcc).decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 272              to.extend(bcc) 
 273          if message == None: 
 274              text = html = None 
 275          elif isinstance(message, (list, tuple)): 
 276              text, html = message 
 277          else: 
 278              text = message 
 279              html = None 
 280          if text != None or html != None: 
 281              attachment = MIMEMultipart.MIMEMultipart('alternative') 
 282              if text != None: 
 283                  if isinstance(text, str): 
 284                      text = text.decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 285                  else: 
 286                      text = text.read().decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 287                  attachment.attach(MIMEText.MIMEText(text)) 
 288              if html != None: 
 289                  if isinstance(html, str): 
 290                      html = html.decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 291                  else: 
 292                      html = html.read().decode(encoding).encode('utf-8') 
 293                  attachment.attach(MIMEText.MIMEText(html, 'html')) 
 294              payload.attach(attachment) 
 295          if attachments == None: 
 296              pass 
 297          elif isinstance(attachments, (list, tuple)): 
 298              for attachment in attachments: 
 299                  payload.attach(attachment) 
 300          else: 
 301              payload.attach(attachments) 
 302          result = {} 
 303          try: 
 304              if self.settings.server == 'gae': 
 305                  from google.appengine.api import mail 
 306                  result = mail.send_mail(sender=self.settings.sender, to=to, 
 307                                          subject=subject, body=text) 
 308              else: 
 309                  server = smtplib.SMTP(*self.settings.server.split(':')) 
 310                  if self.settings.login != None: 
 311                      if self.settings.tls: 
 312                          server.ehlo() 
 313                          server.starttls() 
 314                          server.ehlo() 
 315                      server.login(*self.settings.login.split(':')) 
 316                  result = server.sendmail(self.settings.sender, to, payload.as_string()) 
 317                  server.quit() 
 318          except Exception, e: 
 319              logging.warn('Mail.send failure:%s' % e) 
 320              self.result = result 
 321              self.error = e 
 322              return False 
 323          self.result = result 
 324          self.error = None 
 325          return True

 416 -class Auth(object): 

 417      """ 
 418      Class for authentication, authorization, role based access control. 
 419   
 420      Includes: 
 421   
 422      - registration and profile 
 423      - login and logout 
 424      - username and password retrieval 
 425      - event logging 
 426      - role creation and assignment 
 427      - user defined group/role based permission 
 428   
 429      Authentication Example:: 
 430   
 431          from contrib.utils import * 
 432          mail=Mail() 
 433          mail.settings.server='smtp.gmail.com:587' 
 434          mail.settings.sender='you@somewhere.com' 
 435          mail.settings.login='username:password' 
 436          auth=Auth(globals(), db) 
 437          auth.settings.mailer=mail 
 438          # auth.settings....=... 
 439          auth.define_tables() 
 440          def authentication(): 
 441              return dict(form=auth()) 
 442   
 443      exposes: 
 444   
 445      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/login 
 446      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/logout 
 447      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/register 
 448      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/verify_email 
 449      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_username 
 450      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/retrieve_password 
 451      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/reset_password 
 452      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/profile 
 453      - http://.../{application}/{controller}/authentication/change_password 
 454   
 455      On registration a group with role=new_user.id is created 
 456      and user is given membership of this group. 
 457   
 458      You can create a group with:: 
 459   
 460          group_id=auth.add_group('Manager', 'can access the manage action') 
 461          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'access to manage') 
 462   
 463      Here \"access to manage\" is just a user defined string. 
 464      You can give access to a user:: 
 465   
 466          auth.add_membership(group_id, user_id) 
 467   
 468      If user id is omitted, the logged in user is assumed 
 469   
 470      Then you can decorate any action:: 
 471   
 472          @auth.requires_permission('access to manage') 
 473          def manage(): 
 474              return dict() 
 475   
 476      You can restrict a permission to a specific table:: 
 477   
 478          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable) 
 479          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable) 
 480   
 481      Or to a specific record:: 
 482   
 483          auth.add_permission(group_id, 'edit', db.sometable, 45) 
 484          @auth.requires_permission('edit', db.sometable, 45) 
 485   
 486      If authorization is not granted calls:: 
 487   
 488          auth.settings.on_failed_authorization 
 489   
 490      Other options:: 
 491   
 492          auth.settings.mailer=None 
 493          auth.settings.expiration=3600 # seconds 
 494   
 495          ... 
 496   
 497          ### these are messages that can be customized 
 498          ... 
 499      """ 
 500

1401 -    def random_password(self): 

1402          import string 
1403          import random 
1404          password = '' 
1405          specials=r'!#$*' 
1406          for i in range(0,3):
